#Text=David Schonfeld

#Text=David Joseph Schonfeld ( M.D. , FAAP ) is a professor of the Practice in the Suzanne Dworak-Peck School of Social Work and Pediatrics at the University of Southern California and Children 's Hospital Los Angeles and director at the National Center for School Crisis and Bereavement .
#Text=Education

#Text=Schonfeld attended Boston University School of Medicine and Boston University College of Liberal Arts from which he graduated with B.A. ( Summa Cum Laude ) and M.D. ( Magna Cum Laude ) along with Phi Beta Kappa and Pediatrics Award - all in 1983 . [ 1 ]
#Text=Following graduation , he pursued residency in pediatrics at the Children 's Hospital of Philadelphia at which he served until 1986 .

#Text=He quit the residency following the advise of his mentor there , who told him that he should have pursued behavioral pediatrics fellowship after Schonfeld complained to him that he have learned how to take care of children 's illnesses , but he did n't go into pediatrics because he loves illnesses . [ 2 ]
#Text=He then pursued fellowship in behavioral and developmental pediatrics with the University of Maryland , Baltimore from which he graduated in 1989 . [ 1 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=1990s
#Text=Immediately after University of Maryland , David Schonfeld joined the faculty at Yale School of Medicine as an assistant professor of pediatrics , a position which he kept until 1995 .
#Text=He then relocated to the Yale New Haven Hospital , where he served as its director until 1998 and from 1990 until 2005 maintained the same position at its Lead Program . [ 1 ]
#Text=When Gulf War broke out in 1991 , Schonfeld participated at a meeting regarding children cope with war at the Yale Child Study Center , a department of the Yale School of Medicine .
#Text=There , he found out that children at New Haven , Connecticut are more impacted by city violence then war . [ 2 ]

#Text=In an interview with Nicole Wise of The New York Times in 1992 , Dr. Schonfeld had suggested that parents should n't be afraid to talk to their children about AIDS and should start explaining it to children who are as early as 3-4 year old . [ 3 ]
#Text=2000s
#Text=After September 11 attacks , he educated fellow teachers ' unions , such as the American Federation of Teachers , on how to help children to cope with a loss of their loved one .
#Text=In the study that was conducted by him , it was revealed that only 7 % of teachers had received training and only 3 % of school districts offer such courses . [ 2 ]

#Text=In 2005 , David Schonfeld had received funding from the September 11th Children 's Fund to establish National Center for School Crisis and Bereavement at the University of Southern California School of Social Work and several years prior to it , he obtained additional funding from the New York Life Foundation to expand the center and construct the Coalition to Support Grieving Students . [ 2 ]
#Text=From 2005 to 2012

#Text=Schonfeld was the Thelma and Jack Rubinstein Professor of Pediatrics and director of the Division of Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics [ 4 ] at Cincinnati Children 's Hospital Medical Center .
#Text=From 2006 to 2015 he was a visiting professor at the University of Eastern Piedmont and at the Vrije Universiteit Brussel .
#Text=2010s
#Text=When the shooting at Aurora , Colorado happened in 2012 , David Schonfeld was invited to speak at the school the next day . [ 5 ]
#Text=From 2013 to 2015 he was pediatrician-in-chief at the St. Christopher 's Hospital for Children and chairman and professor of pediatrics at Drexel University College of Medicine . [ 1 ]
#Text=Upon expiration of his position at Drexel University , he joined the faculty of the University of Southern California and its Suzanne Dworak-Peck School of Social Work and Pediatrics . [ 2 ]
#Text=In 2015 he spoke on the Healthy Children Radio regarding natural disasters and gun violence and how to cope with them . [ 6 ]

#Text=In 2016 he , Steven Krug ( Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine ) and Daniel Fagbuyi ( George Washington University School of Medicine ) had compiled a report in which they criticized the U.S. government for not providing enough funding for the medical needs of children during public health emergencies . [ 7 ]

#Text=In March that year he spoke at a free community forum to discuss childhood trauma and crisis of the Our Lady of the Lake Children 's Hospital following the 2016 shooting of Baton Rouge police officers . [ 8 ]
#Text=Following the 2017 Las Vegas shooting , David Schonfeld and Marleen Wong had traveled to Las Vegas where they addressed issues on post-traumatic stress disorder , anxiety and grief . [ 9 ]

#Text=In 2018 , Dr. Schonfeld and the New York Life Foundation had launched Grief-Sensitive Schools Initiative which will train New York Life employees to deliver public speaking about grief in public schools . [ 10 ]
#Text=When Nipsey Hussle died in 2019 , Schonfeld was quoted by Fox News saying , " People want to come together to support each other .

column1: #Text=Personal life
#Text=Schonfeld have two grown up daughters [ 23 ] one of which is Kim . [ 24 ]
